properties.Description: Governor of Minnesota, Tim Walz is leading an effort in combating racism against Asian Americans following the coronavirus pandemic.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Amid anti-Asian bias because of COVID-19, Minnesota launches discrimination helpline

properties.Description: J Chong, an Asian-American chef was "Zoombombed: by random people calling her racial slurs in relation to the coronavirus pandemic.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Anti-Asian 'Zoombombing' of NC Woman Shows Troubling Trend

properties.Description: The NYPD is forming an Asian Hate Crime Task Force, its first-ever force dedicated to investigating crimes targeting a single race. The city has seen a rise in hate crimes directed at Asian people since the coronavirus pandemic began
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Title: NYPD Forms Asian Hate Crime Task Force

properties.Description: NPR's Lulu Garcia-Navarro speaks with community organizer Glo Choi of the HANA Center in Chicago about undocumented workers who won't receive protection under the coronavirus relief package.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: Our Beloved Community Is Abundant, Caring and Joyful
properties.Title: What Happens If Undocumented Immigrants Get Infected With Coronavirus?

properties.Description: San Francisco Mayor London Breed joined city officials, including District Attorney-elect Chesa Boudin, to condemn the violent attack on three seniors at a popular Chinatown gathering spot over the weekend.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: City officials, seniors condemn brutal Chinatown attacks

properties.Description: Residents of Richmond demand an extension of housing evictions following the coronavirus pandemic.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Advocates demand extension of eviction moratorium

properties.Description: In response to the growing amount of hate crimes against Asian-Americans, communities have banded together to address the racial issues and to honor Asian Pacific American Heritage month via a virtual community chat.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez (double check)
properties.Theme v2: Our Beloved Community Is Abundant, Caring and Joyful
properties.Title: Virtual Community Chat addressing Hate Crimes against the Asian Community in Chicago

properties.Description: As the spread of COVID-19 spreads, fear and hate towards Asian-Americans grows more exponentially.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Coronavirus Is Fueling Prejudice, Asian-American Group Says

properties.Description: Many immigrant citizens in Oregon are unable to learn about Coronavirus updates due to a language barrier but are being helped by local communities. Organizations also set up GoFundMe campaigns to help fund medical care, housing, and basic necessities.
properties.Grantee Org: Asian Pacific American Network of Oregon
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: Our Beloved Community Is Abundant, Caring and Joyful
properties.Title: Immigrant Communities In Oregon Struggle To Access Coronavirus Information

properties.Description: Most adults say tensions between black people and police and concerns about the treatment of black people in the U.S. – in addition to anger over Floyd’s death – have contributed a great deal to the protests, according to a new Pew Research Center survey.
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Title: Amid Protests, Majorities Across Racial and Ethnic Groups Express Support for the Black Lives Matter Movement

properties.Description: This piece conveys the importance of voting locally and nationally for the future we want. Sikhs have a deep history in California but have not been able to enjoy the same rights as others. #VotingTogether
properties.Name: Silvia Gonzalez
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: "The Sikh Vote by Salvin Chahal #VotingTogether"

properties.Description: In a congressional district that has been one of the hardest hit by the novel coronavirus in what is thus far the most affected city in the country, community organizations are focused on simultaneously providing the type of support that their members and clients have always relied on them for, while gently prodding them to exercise their civic voice in the election. During the New York primaries in June, Mekong NYC dropped off care packages while providing information and materials related to the 2020 Census, access to health care, and elections, including information about where to vote and how to vote in-person and via mail.
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Title: A Pandemic and A Primary in the Most Impoverished Congressional District in the Country

properties.Description: In a telephone press briefing, leaders from All Voting is Local, Asian Americans Advancing Justice, the Coalition for the People’s Agenda, Common Cause Georgia, the Georgia Association of Latino Elected Officials, Georgia NAACP, and the New Georgia Project, urged Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger and State Election Board members to do their job to ensure the devastating failures of Tuesday’s primary are not repeated in November.
properties.Title: Georgia voting rights leaders warned about failures of June 9 primary

properties.Description: As COVID-19 continues to spread in the United States, the harassment of the Asian population in America have been targeted in cities such as Philadelphia.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: In coronavirus crisis, Asians in Pa. are facing more discrimination and harassment

properties.Description: During the Summer of 2019, my family took a trip to China and Hong Kong. It was the first time for many of us. For dad, it was his first time back after 37 years. One of the most impactful experiences during the trip was when we visited Choi Hung, Hong Kong. Choi Hung translates to rainbow, which I still laugh about sometimes, because now my father has a gay son – me!
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: “Stepping into Choi Hung” by Tyler Sit

properties.Description: Asian Americans living in Boston's Chinatown are at risk of being displaced from their own homes due to high rent, so the tenents, along with local activists, have decided to take action by combatting the expensive rent through petitions and exposure.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Asian Americans facing high risk of displacement mobilize to fight back

properties.Description: More than 1 million North Carolina residents have registered, or re-registered, to vote since the 2016 election. A lot of the new voters are young - and are more than twice as likely to identify as Latinx or Asian than in previous elections.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: NC's Newest Voters Are Young And Likely Hispanic Or Asian

properties.Description: Following the death of George Floyd, Asian Americans and their communities have risen up in the demand for justice of George Floyd.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: 'We need to help them': Asian Americans demand justice for George Floyd

properties.Description: In L.A. County, Pacific Islanders suffer the highest infection rate of any racial or ethnic group, more than 2,500 per 100,000 residents. That’s six times higher than for white people, five times higher than for Black people and three times higher than for Latinos, according to county health demographic data.
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: ‘I was naive to think this couldn’t touch my family’: Pacific Islanders hit hard by the coronavirus

properties.Description: The Virginia Department of Health will begin releasing more comprehensive demographic data on the commonwealth’s coronavirus cases and deaths on Monday. It’s a move that advocates have awaited for months, arguing that without detailed race and ethnicity data, it’s impossible to determine the full impact on the state’s most vulnerable populations.
properties.Grantee Org: Asian American Pacific Islander Civic Engagement
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Virginia Will Expand Racial COVID-19 Data Reporting After Criticism From Advocates And Experts

properties.Description: The biggest obstacle facing Asian American and Pacific Islander communities is a gap in translation services. Organizations that serve Asian American and Pacific Islander communities in the Philadelphia region want to connect 10,000 households in Pennsylvania to health and financial resources as they navigate COVID-19 shutdowns. VietLead organizers have complemented state and city resources with webinars to answer questions from community members in Vietnamese.
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Theme v2: Our Beloved Community Is Abundant, Caring and Joyful
properties.Title: Volunteers needed to translate coronavirus help for Philly area Asian Americans

properties.Description: A group of Louisiana advocacy organizations is looking to the future, to when the state will be recovering from the coronavirus COVID-19 pandemic. Louisiana isn't a stranger to disaster recovery, but efforts in the past have often left out the state's most vulnerable populations or ultimately exacerbated problems that squeeze working communities and people of color.
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: Louisiana advocacy organizations have a roadmap for an equitable COVID-19 recovery

properties.Description: By some estimates the world's population is 60% Asian. So it's hard to look at someone who appears to be Asian and determine the country of their ancestry. But Asians who live in America, no matter their ancestral home, are reporting being singled out by those who are calling COVID-19 the Chinese virus.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Triangle Asian American group encourages reporting of pandemic-related discrimination

properties.Description: As the first reported cases of COVID-19 appeared in the Bay Area in March, AAPI groups were able to help spread awareness on the spread of the virus.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: How a bilingual media program taught a Chinese community about COVID-19

properties.Description: In response to the growing amount of hate crimes against Asian-Americans from COVID-19, civil rights activists have launched the creation of a reporting center for Asian-Americans to report an incident of discrimination made against them.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez (double check)
properties.Title: Civil Rights Organizations Establish STOP AAPI HATE Reporting Center

properties.Description: As fear of the coronavirus grows, hate grows against Asian-Americans living in Cleveland, Ohio.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Asian community group, worried by coronavirus-related racism, urges Clevelanders to ‘get the facts’

properties.Description: Demonstrators from Freedom Inc. spent a few hours overnight spray painting "Defend Black Women" on Doty Street.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Latest street message: ‘Defend Black Womxn’

properties.Description: With widespread economic uncertainty, the act of paying—or not paying rent—has become a flash point for both renters and landlords who say they are not receiving enough emergency support to cope with months of missed income. In response, community organizers and tenants are getting creative and turning to digital tools as part of a nation-wide push to cancel rent payments during the pandemic with a rash of both rent and labor strikes. Given the hardships low income communities of color are facing and the inequities in the governmental response to the crisis, groups like CAAAV-Organizing Asian Communities won one of the strongest eviction moratoriums in the country.
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Title: In New York, the rent strike movement takes root

properties.Description: Juneteenth is a holiday that marks the final end of chattel slavery in the United States, the announcement by Union army general Gordon Granger in Galveston, Texas, on June 19, 1865, that all slaves in Texas were free–some two years after the Emancipation Proclamation. This year, the holiday was celebrated in towns big and small with marches and rallies demanding an end to systemic racism and racist police terror.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: Juneteenth 2020 marked as day of struggle for Black liberation

properties.Description: 192 employees who were laid off from the Four Seasons Hotel in Boston fought the hote with support of local AAPI groups and won a severance package after not getting paid what they were owed.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: Laid off Four Seasons workers to receive full severance package amid coronavirus crisis

properties.Description: In the state of Wisconsin, many organizations are going above and beyond to make sure victims can get in touch with resources after experiencing an act of discrimination.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: Our Beloved Community Is Abundant, Caring and Joyful
properties.Title: Domestic violence helpline available over text

properties.Description:
Asian representation is finally gaining a foothold in mainstream media. It’s been a long time coming, seeing as Asians are the fastest-growing major ethnic group in the United States. However, it’s still only breaking the surface.
While Asian Americans are often seen as a monolithic group, the diversity within it is vast.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez (double check)
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: The Changing Demographics of Asian Americans

properties.Description: Many private donors and organizations have donated to services that help undocumented immigrants with relief efforts during the coronavirus pandemic.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: How Coronavirus Relief Is Being Distributed to Undocumented Immigrants

properties.Description: Whites make three times as much as Hispanic workers, twice as much as black workers.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: Our Beloved Community Is Abundant, Caring and Joyful
properties.Title: Alexandria’s Income Gaps

properties.Description: Every year, I stared at one page in the Girl Scouts summer activities brochure: “Horseback Riding Camps.” I feared asking my parents if I could go, assuming it would be too expensive. My perpetual silence landed me at Sup Sogui Hosu instead—a Korean language immersion program near Hackensack, Minnesota. Sup Sogui Hosu was my mom’s idea. She wanted me to explore the pieces of our heritage that her mother never let her explore.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: "Just Wait Until My Mom Gets Here!" by Madison Johnston

properties.Description: During the wave of hate crimes reported in America, ex-presidential candidate, Andrew Yang told Asian-American communities to "embrace and show our American-ness" to prove to Americans that they are indeed, true American citizens.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez (double check)
properties.Title: We don’t have to prove our ‘American-ness’

properties.Description: A narrowly divided Supreme Court extended Thursday a life-support line to some 650,000 so-called DREAMers, allowing them to remain safe from deportation for now, while the Trump administration jumps through the administrative hoops that the court said are required before ending the program.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Supreme Court Upholds DACA, Protecting 'Dreamers' (For Now)

properties.Description: Congressman Ron Kind held his first listening session of the year at Western Technical College on Wednesday. Constituents brought up the potential Hmong deportations frequently throughout the listening session. The Hmong nonprofit Cia Siab Inc. which operates in La Crosse, read off statements regarding their concerns for their community.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Rep. Kind address concerns over potential Hmong deportations at a listening session

properties.Description: Hate incidents directed at Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders are exploding this year, according to advocates pushing for California Gov. Gavin Newsom to boost funding for programs fighting bias and add a cultural representative to his new COVID-19 task force.
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Title: 'You started the corona!' As anti-Asian hate incidents explode, climbing past 800, activists push for aid

properties.Description: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo was in Laos in late January, discussed the potential deportation of more than 4,500 Hmong and Lao refugees. However, deportation could mean potential persecution for some of the refugees.  Over the past two decades, the U.S. started deportation proceedings in court against almost 5,000 Lao citizens. While courts are not required to report, many of the citizens are Hmong.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Trump Administration in Talks with Laos Regarding Hmong Deportations

properties.Description: Many Japanese communities all across the country have risen up for the support of BLM and the end to racial discrimination.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez (double check)
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: Tsuru For Solidarity: Nikkei Voices of Protest

properties.Description: Ever since the start of COVID-19, racism and hate against Asian-Americans have increased exponentially. Civil rights groups such as the Asian Americans Advancing Justice in Chicago have stood up in defense of their Asian-American communities.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez (double check)
properties.Title: How the Pandemic Changed—and Fueled—the Fight Against Anti-Asian Racism

properties.Description: Asian residents make up just under 4% of the Summit County population but account for nearly 20% of coronavirus cases in the county, according to Summit County Public Health data.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: Asian residents account for nearly 1 in 5 Summit County coronavirus cases

properties.Description: Donald Trump's racist comments towards Asian-Americans are largely responsible for the rise of hate crimes against Asian-Americans. Incidents involving discrimination and physical assaults against Asian-Americans have seen an increase during the past few months of COVID-19.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Op-Ed:  Trump’s racist comments are fueling hate crimes against Asian Americans. Time for state leaders to step in

properties.Description: The coronavirus death rate among minorities is substantially higher than that of whites, according to Los Angeles County officials. Whites were the least likely to die from the virus, with 13 fatalities reported per 100,000 Caucasian residents. But for every 100,000 Native Hawaiian/Pacific Islander residents, there were 53 to 154 deaths — a rate four to 12 times higher than for white people.
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: Whites far less likely to die from the coronavirus than blacks, Latinos in L.A. County

properties.Description: School districts have faced increased pressure to terminate school contracts with police across the country. Eight days after the police killing of George Floyd, the Minneapolis Board of Education voted to unanimously terminate its contract with the police department.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Madison Mayor Announces Vote To Remove Police From Local Schools

properties.Description: Right now, civic empowerment organizations like VietLead are in the homestretch to get as many new voters registered for the November election as possible. They have been diligently forging connections with the Vietnamese and Southeast Asian communities in Philly over the past five years.
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Title: VietLead and activating the Southeast Asian vote in Philadelphia

properties.Description: Cambodians’ Struggle for Refuge - Chapter 1: Genocide and Displacement
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: Struggle for Refuge - Part 1

properties.Description: Many Asian Americans are collectively being subjected to racism due to the novel coronavirus outbreak. Rising Voices of Asian American Families started a #NoAAPIHate campaign to provide Asian Americans with a platform that allows them to speak out during this pandemic.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Essay: Asian American is not a disease

properties.Description: At a rally in Tulsa, Oklahoma, Donald Trump was criticized for the use of the phrase "Kung-Flu" for COVID-19. Trump's use of the phrase was derogatory towards Chinese and Chinese-Americans and could exacerbate hate attacks against Asian-Americans
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Trump can't claim 'Kung Flu' doesn't affect Asian Americans in this climate, experts say

properties.Description: The spread of COVID-19 and racists remarks made by Donald Trump towards Asian-Americans have contributed to the growth of hate-crimes against Asian-Americans.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Asian-Americans in Minnesota face insults, hostility during virus outbreak

properties.Description: The spread of coronavirus in the United States has caused a rise in hate-crimes against Asian-Americans in states such as Minnesota.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: ‘We don’t feel safe’: Asian Americans navigate racism amid COVID-19 crisis

properties.Description: Demographic information in that data shows that people of color make up 40% of the confirmed coronavirus cases in Multnomah County. For the entire Portland region, including those four counties, people of color make up about 43% of confirmed cases.
properties.Grantee Org: Asian Pacific American Network of Oregon
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez (double check)
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: People Of Color Disproportionately Represented In Coronavirus Caseload

properties.Description: They [Asian-Americans] went to protests in Houston and El Paso, spoke at an online town hall in Midland and held small celebrations amid national upheaval. In this weekly series, Texans from across the state share stories about how they’re navigating life during the COVID-19 pandemic.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: “The African American community is not alone”: A Houston restaurant owner joins the protests

properties.Description: I want Philadelphians to know that what is happening to me is an attempt to criminalize nonviolent peaceful protest. I believe this arrest was an attempt to silence and intimidate me, and my community, people of the Viet diaspora, Asian Americans, and immigrants broadly, from doing what we need to do as active citizens: speak truth to power.
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: My arrest after protesting ICE was an attempt to silence Asian Americans and immigrants | Opinion

properties.Description: It’s June 15, 2014. Father’s Day barbecue in our backyard. My older sister sits my mom down at the head of our dinner table. I sit beside her and my sister settles across from me. Mom anchors her eyebrows and asks why the sudden formality. With my previous consent, my sister suddenly blurted out, “PajYeeb likes girls.”
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: "Family Ties" by Cameron PajYeeb Yang

properties.Description: As the number of infected with COVID-19 rise in China, fear and racism has increased against Asian-Americans in the city of Philadelphia.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenezz
properties.Title: Coronavirus hasn’t reached Philly. But fear and racism are spreading.

properties.Description: The Sacramento City Unified School District is considering fully divesting from the Sacramento Police Department.
properties.Theme v2: Curiosity Is the Path to Our Best Future
properties.Title: Sacramento City Schools Consider Ending Police Contract For School Resource Officers

properties.Description: Donald Trump has been quoted with calling Asian-Americans a series of derogatory terms in relation to COVID-19, leading to a rise of discriminatory actions in Minneapolis.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Asian-Americans feel targeted with 'Chinese virus' label

properties.Description: The Providence City Council Finance Committee is planning to discuss “requests for defunding of the Providence Police Department” at its meeting Wednesday night, amid a nationwide movement to slash police budgets and reallocate funds to other services.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Defunding the police will get Providence City Council hearing tonight

properties.Description: As a result of COVID-19's spread in New York City, half of immigrant workers in the city have lost their job and their subsequent ability to get relief because of a loss of income.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: Half of NYC’s Immigrants are Unemployed Because of the Pandemic, Report Finds

properties.Description: Traffic around Philadelphia City Hall came to a standstill for over an hour April 9 as hundreds of protesters, from social distance in their cars, demanded Mayor Jim Kenney and First Judicial District Judges Patrick Dugan, Leon Tucker and Idee Fox decrease the number of incarcerated people in the city’s jails.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Caravan targets City Hall and jail in Philly protest

properties.Description: Just over a week ago, Freedom, Inc. and other groups organized the first march in Madison against police brutality and honoring George Floyd.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Freedom, Inc. protest organizers reflect on week of action

properties.Description: The rapid spread of COVID-19 and the subsequent rise of hate crimes against Asian-Americans has lead to multiple organizations to come together and combat racism against Asian-American. One such organization is the Asian Americans Advancing Justice chapter in Georgia.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Local Advocates Concerned About Anti-Asian Racism Amid Pandemic

properties.Description: Community members on Tuesday demanded the Madison School Board take immediate action to terminate the school district’s contract with the Madison Police Department following the death of George Floyd.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Freedom Inc. protest calls for immediate end to police in Madison schools

properties.Description: During this turbulent time, Asian-Americans in the state of Minnesota have been experiencing a wave of racism, but there are ways to help them combat racism through methods listed in the article by notable figures.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: How to be an ally for Asian Americans facing racism amid COVID-19

properties.Description: Voices from Asian American business owners on the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic, and their responses.
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Title: Asian American Businesses and the COVID-19 Pandemic: Looking into Life Before and After

properties.Description: Gaosong Heu talks about reactions in the Hmong community to the killing of George Floyd. Former police officer Tou Thao, a Hmong American, is seen on video of the killing running interference with the crowd and standing watch. His involvement has stirred a racial debate among Asian Americans.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: For One Immigrant Community, George Floyd's Death Isn't Just About Black And White

properties.Description: As COVID-19 spreads throughout Oregon, some small businesses in metropolitan ares that were forced to close are being granted relief funds by local communities. APANO added $50,000 to the fund for businesses in need. The organization also started taking donations to help workers in those neighborhoods impacted by reduced hours or layoffs.
properties.Grantee Org: Asian Pacific American Network of Oregon
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: Our Beloved Community Is Abundant, Caring and Joyful
properties.Title: How Asian and Chinese businesses are dealing with COVID-19

properties.Description: A photograph slide show of the past and present locations within Little Tokyo.
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: Little Tokyo Then and Now

properties.Description: Nothing has been left untouched by the outpouring of rage, despair and horror in the days after the shooting of Jacob Blake, a Black man, by police. Yet the messages left by residents offer words of hope for a city that’s still trying to heal after civil unrest erupted here, in nearby Milwaukee and across the country following the shooting.
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Title: ‘Examine your heart’: Healing from turmoil, Wisconsin voters have a message for America

properties.Description: Cambodians’ Struggle for Refuge - Chapter 2: Resettlement and Culture
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: Struggle for Refuge - Part 2

properties.Description: Many advocates and Complete Count Committees, the outreach arm of the census, had events planned around the census to educate and help those who needed help filling out the document. Now, they worry coronavirus precautions could limit their reach.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Advocates Worry Coronavirus Could Impact California Census Count

properties.Description: About four-in-ten Black and Asian adults say people have acted as if they were uncomfortable around them because of their race or ethnicity since the beginning of the outbreak, and similar shares say they worry that other people might be suspicious of them if they wear a mask when out in public, according to a new Pew Research Center survey.
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: Many Black and Asian Americans Say They Have Experienced Discrimination Amid the COVID-19 Outbreak

properties.Description:
In Cleveland, Ohio, the Asian population make up 4% of the population but account for 18% of deaths from COVID-19. At the same time, the health department is noticing another alarming overall trend. Summit County’s COVID-19 death rate is twice Ohio’s average. Skoda attributes it to the high number of nursing homes and assisted living facilities in the county. “At Asian Services in Action we have the capacity to provide interpreting and translation services in 55 languages and dialects,” Tso said.

Her agency serves Akron’s Bhutanese refugees, Burmese, Karen, Hmong, Chinese, and a growing number of Congolese immigrants, all of them struggling to understand a bewildering array of closures, state orders, and health care protocols.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: Two COVID-19 Disparities in Summit County: Death Rate High, Asian Residents Disproportionately Affected

properties.Description: As a young person who grew up in a predominantly white community, I felt that to relate to white Americans I had to hide who I was. I was ashamed of being Asian. My family was different from our white neighbors, and I was embarrassed by our difference. I was made to feel like I needed to be like the white people around us or I wouldn’t be accepted. It seemed like there was so much I needed to change.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: “I am Enough” by Brianna To

properties.Description: The Providence Police Department has revised its policy around identifying and storing information on suspected gang members as part of a settlement reached with the activist group Providence Youth Student Movement, which sued the department over the policy in January.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: In settlement with activists, Providence police gang database is now a narrower dragnet

properties.Description: Since the start of the outbreak of COVID-19, Asian-Americans have reported an increase of discrimination against them. Incidents such as verbal abuse, denial of public transport and discrimination on the job are incidents that have been reported by Asian-Americans.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Asian Americans report rise in racist attacks amid pandemic

properties.Description: Mandy Zhang, an Asian-American teenager, showed her support for the Black Lives Matter movement along with the support of the local Asian-American community in Chicago. This sparked a movement for the Asian/Pacific Islander support of BLM in areas such as San Francisco, Minnesota and the U.S. territory of American Samoa.
properties.Grantee Org: Coalition of Asian American Leaders, Southeast Asian Freedom Network, Empowering Pacific Islander Communities, Mekong NYC, Freedom, Inc., Asian American Advancing Justice - Atlanta,
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: Curiosity Is the Path to Our Best Future
properties.Title: 75 ways Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders are speaking out for Black lives

properties.Description: Coronavirus is leaving an impact on national census operations, so some community advocates are shifting their strategy in order to increase the number of community members who respond to the census. New Mexico Asian Family Center switched from door canvasses and events to phone banking and other forms of remote communications.
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: Coronavirus delays census operations nationwide, how census advocates are adjusting

properties.Description: Hundreds of protesters took to the streets and marched to the Rhode Island State House in honor of black lives and George Floyd.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Selene Means: Providence Juneteenth Youth after their Liberation

properties.Description: The New Mexico Complete Count Commission, a coalition of state and community leaders, is producing audio recordings explaining how to fill out census forms in the languages of New Mexico's Native American tribes.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: New Mexico Cuts Census Barriers for Native Language Speakers

properties.Description: 17% of New York's population, or roughly 1.5 million residents, live in crowded homes that are prone to the faster spread of COVID-19.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: New Yorkers Sharing Crowded Apartments Struggle With Coronavirus Quarantines & Social Distancing

properties.Description: When the names of the four officers involved in George Floyd’s arrest were released, Dr. Chao Vang, founder of Project HMONG at Sacramento State, knew immediately that one of them was Hmong.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: Tou Thao’s role in George Floyd killing has Sacramentans discussing Hmong-black relations

properties.Description: Organizers with Charlotte Uprising, Southeast Asian Coalition (SEAC), and Feed the Movement CLT gathered in front of District Attorney Spencer Merriweather’s office on Monday to call on him to drop all charges related to protests that have been held in Charlotte over the last 25 days.
properties.Title: Organizers Call on D.A. Merriweather to Drop All Protest Charges

properties.Description: As the coronavirus spread across the country, Hmong Asians in the state of Minnesota are facing fears of being deported from their homes.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: Fear, anxiety in Minnesota over plans to deport some Hmong residents

properties.Description: Across the country, Asian American health-care workers have reported a rise in bigoted incidents. The racial hostility has left Asian Americans, who represent 6 percent of the U.S. population but 18 percent of the country’s physicians and 10 percent of its nurse practitioners, in a painful position on the front lines of the response to the coronavirus pandemic. Some covid-19 patients refuse to be treated by them. And when doctors and nurses leave the hospital, they face increasing harassment in their daily lives, too.
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Title: Asian American doctors and nurses are fighting racism and the coronavirus

properties.Description: The head of the Congressional Asian Pacific American Caucus said the research shows that anyone who fails to see the link between harmful rhetoric and bigotry is "lying to themselves."
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Title: After Trump's Covid-19 diagnosis, anti-Asian tweets and conspiracies rose 85%: report

properties.Description: The Rhode Island Solidarity Fund has brought together 6 community-led relief efforts to offer a one-stop option for community members and foundations seeking to contribute directly to frontline relief during the Coronavirus crisis.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: WUN-ON-ONE: A conversation with RI Solidarity Fund

properties.Description: Advocacy groups in Pennsylvania have joined to form the PA Immigrant Relief Fund and aim to provide undocumented immigrant families with supplies during the pandemic.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: With undocumented families excluded from coronavirus aid, immigrant organizations step in to help keep food on the table

properties.Description: This week the Madison Metropolitan School Board voted to end its school resource officer (SRO) contract with the Madison Police Department. It was something Freedom, Inc. and its Freedom Youth Squad had been fighting years for, saying the presence of police in schools negatively impacted students of color and made them feel unsafe.
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Theme v2: Our Beloved Community Is Abundant, Caring and Joyful
properties.Title: Freedom Youth Squad celebrates the removal of police officers from Madison schools

properties.Description: Students at the University of New Mexico have started a petition asking administrators to create an Asian and Pacific Islander resource center after Asian and Pacific Islander communities have seen an increased amount of discrimination because of COVID-19.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: UNM students ask for Asian and Pacific Islander resource center after experiencing COVID-19 racism

properties.Description: As more and more small businesses are being affected, $200,000 will be given as a relief fund to the Jade, District of Portland. $150,000 comes from the government while the other $50,000 will come from the Asian Pacific American Network of Oregon.
properties.Grantee Org: Asian Pacific American Network of Oregon
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: Our Beloved Community Is Abundant, Caring and Joyful
properties.Title: Nearly $200,000 in grants could reach Portland small businesses hurt by coronavirus next week

properties.Description: More than 800 Asian-Americans in California have been a victim of hate crimes in relation to COVID-19 since the month of May. This includes physical altercations, being banned from establishments, being unable to use public transportation, possible civil rights violations and racist remarks from Donald Trump.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: 800+ Hate Crimes Against Asians in California Reported in Past 3 Months

properties.Description: The Black Lives Matter movement has descended on Utah, with chants of “no justice, no peace,” “I can’t breathe,” and “our streets.”
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Urged to get out and vote, 1K protesters eschew marching after early morning Black Lives Matter gathering

properties.Description: Members of Albuquerque’s Asian American community said they are being targeted and do not feel safe during this coronavirus pandemic.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Asian American community speaking out against racism during coronavirus pandemic

properties.Description: The Asian Pacific American Network of Oregon has been issuing small grants to small businesses in Portland's Jade District.
properties.Grantee Org: Asian Pacific American Network of Oregon
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: New details for Jade District grant program

properties.Description: Mayor Ted Wheeler announced Prosper Portland, the city’s economic development agency, is making a $150,000 grant available to the Jade District neighborhood to help support one of the hardest financially impacted areas of Portland. The grant is specifically slated for Asian American-owned businesses throughout the city, but with a focus on businesses within the Jade District neighborhood proper.
properties.Grantee Org: Asian Pacific American Network of Oregon
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez (double check)
properties.Theme v2: Our Beloved Community Is Abundant, Caring and Joyful
properties.Title: Jade District Businesses Offered $150k of Relief Grants After Weeks of Declining Business

properties.Description: Supporters of the Madison non-profit examine how a recent Daniel Bice column gets it wrong.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Guest column: Freedom Inc. faces down racist media narratives

properties.Description: Asian communities in Atlanta, Georgia are encouraging Asian-Americans to partake in the 2020 census. Recent studies show that Asians are the fastest growing group but are least likely to not fill the 2020 Census report.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Metro Atlanta’s Asian Community Gears Up For 2020 Census

properties.Description: IN partnership with community groups, organizations and foundations, as well as more than sixty individual donors, Filipino Advocates for Justice has raised awareness and funds for the Bayanihan COVID-19 Relief Fund.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: Our Beloved Community Is Abundant, Caring and Joyful
properties.Title: Applications open for Bayanihan COVID-19 Relief Fund

properties.Description: Cambodians’ Struggle for Refuge - Chapter 3: Gentrification
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: Struggle for Refuge - Part 3

properties.Description: This film details the daily lives of Cambodian-owned donut shop workers, owners, and family members while highlighting both the success and struggles.
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: Donuts for Dollars

properties.Description: South Philly’s SEAMAAC has fed thousands of people since March, while continuing to push the vote and the census—missions more aligned than you might think. It’s all part of SEAMAAC’s larger mission, to better serve its constituents by helping them better engage with their city. Civics and food naturally overlap and food insecurity is a social justice issue. Voting and the census is part of that.
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Theme v2: Our Beloved Community Is Abundant, Caring and Joyful
properties.Title: SEAMAAC feeds thousands - and gets out the vote - during COVID-19

properties.Description: After four years of demanding police-free schools, Freedom, Inc. said the Madison School Board could be days away from ending its contract with police.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Freedom Inc. rallies for police-free schools statewide, refuses to condemn Tuesday’s violence

properties.Description: Since well before the Vietnam War, Southeast Asian migrants have faced racism, targeted immigration enforcement, and denial of their basic human rights.
properties.Theme v2: Our Beloved Community Is Abundant, Caring and Joyful
properties.Title: Anti-Asian Immigration Violence Is Nothing New

properties.Description: As COVID-19 hit the United States, many small business were forced to close their doors. This article provides ways to help keep small businesses stay afloat, such as purchasing gift cards or advocating for policies that will put less strain on small businesses.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez (double check)
properties.Theme v2: Our Beloved Community Is Abundant, Caring and Joyful
properties.Title: How Can We Support Small Businesses During Coronavirus?

properties.Description: In the midst of this economic devastation, Houston’s Asian community rallied, and Asian-American organizations became some of the most generous donors to frontline workers and individuals in need. The collaboration also has an advocacy arm to address the ignorance and anti-Asian sentiment that shut Chinatown down in the first place.
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Theme v2: Our Beloved Community Is Abundant, Caring and Joyful
properties.Title: Asian-American groups band together for COVID relief

properties.Description: Communities raise concerns about the coronavirus and its impact on the 2020 Census.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Coronavirus Concern Has Census Outreach Shifting Tactics

properties.Description: A Minneapolis nonprofit makes sure immigrant communities can access culturally specific food like basmati rice, vermicelli noodles and fish sauce during the pandemic.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: Our Beloved Community Is Abundant, Caring and Joyful
properties.Title: Food pantry offers culturally specific items to immigrant communities amid pandemic

properties.Description: Boston's Chinatown will now have it's own public library after the Chinese Progressive Association Chinese Youth Initiative pressured the city of Boston to build one.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: After Years of Organizing, Affordable Housing, Library Coming to Boston Chinatown

properties.Description: Organizations that serve Asian-Americans and Pacific Islanders are taking efforts to notify the populace of Philadelphia, especially non-English speaking residents to areas where services can be provided amid COVID-19 shutdowns.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Volunteers needed to translate coronavirus help for Philly area Asian Americans
properties.URL: Volunteers needed to translate coronavirus help for Philly area Asian Americans

properties.Description: Anti-Asian American sentiment during the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic is a growing concern among state leaders.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Michigan leaders encourage reporting of anti-Asian American hate crimes amid COVID-19

properties.Description: Asian-American communities in Chicago are helping non-English speakers during the pandemic by keeping them informed about COVID-19 and providing them resources to help them protect themselves from the virus.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: For Non-English Speakers, Language Is A Barrier During The COVID-19 Pandemic

properties.Description: Multiple incidents of hate crimes against Asian-Americans have gained attention across the state of California in response to the growing spread of COVID-19. Racial comments made by children and adults alike all contributed to the sudden rise of hate crimes against Asian-Americans in California.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Tracking the Latest Chapter of Anti-Asian Racism in America

properties.Description: Amid the ongoing threat of the coronavirus, there are surging reports of xenophobic and racist incidents targeting members of the Asian American and Pacific Islander (AAPI) community in the U.S. Visit the website to see a representative list of coronavirus-related anti-Asian incidents reported in the media or by the victims. The description of the victims is based on media reporting.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Reports of Anti-Asian Assaults, Harassment and Hate Crimes Rise as Coronavirus Spreads

properties.Description: Private donors and independent organizations have connected to move millions of dollars in aid across a gaping hole left in the government’s COVID-19 response
properties.Title: How Coronavirus Relief Is Being Distributed to Undocumented Immigrants

properties.Description: Coronavirus, Black Lives Matter and a Chevron slip-up highlight how environmentalism has failed black communities – calling for new models of activism
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: US climate activists confront the movement’s whiteness problem

properties.Description: The FBI sent a letter to law enforcement agencies across the country this week raising concerns about potential hate crimes during the coronavirus pandemic
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Asians, Asian-Americans Feeling the Pain of Prejudice During Pandemic

properties.Description: To monitor and document incidents of anti-Asian discrimination in North Carolina stemming from racialization of the COVID-19 outbreak, North Carolina Asian Americans Together (NCAAT) has launched a statewide bias reporting portal. This initiative will provide NCAAT with insight to help advocate on behalf of our community members throughout North Carolina.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: NCAAT offers safe space for Asian Americans in NC to report anti-Asian incidents amid COVID-19 outbreak

properties.Description: Residents of New Mexico are hard to count because it's big, area-wise, and because plenty of communities are intentionally discouraged from filling the 2020 Census out through fear tactics.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: YNMG & COVID: To Be Heard And Counted

properties.Description: Protestors march to the Rhode Island State House, stage sit-in, demand school, statewide, national change
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Providence youth lead Juneteenth rally, draw over 1,000 participants

properties.Description: Distressed by the rise in xenophobia and racism during the coronavirus pandemic, a coalition of Asian American groups based in California have created a reporting webpage for victims of virus-related hate crimes. The Asian Pacific Planning and Policy Council, Chinese for Affirmative Action and San Francisco State University Asian American Studies Department are asking anyone who’s been harassed, intimidated or otherwise discriminated against for their race to share their stories on the website.
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Title: Coronavirus: Asian American groups compile hate crime reports as Trump persists in ‘Chinese virus’ attacks

properties.Description: Asian-Americans in Minnesota have been experiencing a wave of discrimination after the spread of COVID-19 increased.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: ‘I don’t have the virus’: Asian Americans in Minnesota confront a COVID-19 backlash

properties.Description: Last week, the Providence External Review Authority (PERA) sent a letter to Providence Mayor Jorge Elorza and the Providence City Council “recommending the city reallocate funding from the Providence Police Department and reinvest the funds into PERA, in order to transition to a new, civilian lead model of oversight.”
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Activists urge civilian oversight board to aid in defunding efforts

properties.Description: The streets of Chinatown bear the scars of highway construction, institutional expansion, and urban renewal efforts. Today, a lack of affordable housing and the emergence of Airbnbs and short-term rentals drive up prices for the residents who have built the community from the ground up. Chinatown’s right to take up space continues to be challenged.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: Amid a Rapidly Changing Present, Can Chinatown Preserve Its Past?

properties.Description: Asian American leaders in Massachusetts on Thursday condemned what they say is continued racism, fear-mongering and misinformation aimed at Asian communities amid the coronavirus pandemic that originated in China.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Asian-American leaders in Massachusetts decry racism amid global pandemic

properties.Description: Muslims in Minnesota and across the globe are reworking ancient traditions as the coronavirus upends society. That’s especially evident during Ramadan, Islam’s most sacred month, which began Thursday night with a historic first in Minneapolis.
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Title: Ramadan call to prayers broadcast as Muslims pray at home

properties.Description: As COVID-19 sweeps through Queens, many immigrant neighborhoods haven't been filling out the census form because there are more important issues consider. Many immigrant groups are now relying on phone banking to reach out to their community. Staff at Adhikaar — a non-profit in Elmhurst that works with South Asian immigrants — have placed over 1,000 calls to members of their community in just three weeks.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez (double check)
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: In COVID-19 Epicenter of Queens, Census Response Lags Far Behind

properties.Description: Every 10 years, the federal government spends three months counting everyone living in America, and uses the data to calculate political representation and allocate federal money. This time, there’s a new wrinkle: How do you conduct the Census when everybody is socially distancing? Some strategies may work for some communities, but possibly not for the ones that the Census deems  “hard-to-count.” That includes renters, older residents, and those with limited English proficiency.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: Our Beloved Community Is Abundant, Caring and Joyful
properties.Title: How do you count Americans for 2020 Census when they’re social distancing during coronavirus?

properties.Description: In cities like Akron and Cleveland, contract tracing is being used by to manage COVID-19 and is being used by centers such as the Asian Services In Action.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: Our Beloved Community Is Abundant, Caring and Joyful
properties.Title: Contact Tracing Is a Time-Tested Method for Fighting Outbreaks But It's Facing New Challenges

properties.Description: Alexandria’s poorest areas have been hit hardest by the coronavirus, and local groups are demanding that Virginia Gov. Ralph Northam respond by supplying 10,000 testing kits over the next 10 days and providing housing for COVID-positive patients who currently live in jam-packed residences.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Advocates Demand 10K COVID-19 Tests in Arlandria, Housing Options for Positive Patients

properties.Description: As the fear of the virus spreads, Asian owned small businesses in the Jade District of Portland have been hurting said businesses.
properties.Grantee Org: Asian Pacific American Network of Oregon
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Coronavirus Fear Hurts Some Businesses In Portland's Jade District

properties.Description: Asian Americans show their support for black power and justice for the murder of George Floyd. The death of George Floyd, a Black man, in Minneapolis police custody sparked nationwide protests — and a sense of reckoning in the Asian American community, which has historically fraught, even violent, ties with African Americans. In particular, the revelation that one of the officers charged over Floyd’s death, Tou Thao, is Hmong has caused many Asian Americans to grapple with their community’s complicity.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: George Floyd death sparks Asian American soul-searching

properties.Description: Residents of Richmond demand an extension of housing evictions following the coronavirus pandemic.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Advocates demand extension of eviction moratorium

properties.Description: We are witnessing insensitivity, fear, panic and yes, expressions of racial and ethnic hate and discrimination directed toward those in our midst who are of Asian descent. Members of La Crosse’s Asian population have not been exempt from these attacks. The #Stop AAPI Hate Reporting Center indicates that more than 100 incidents of harassment per day against people of varying Asian backgrounds have been reported in the U.S. since mid-March. Providing support for people of Asian descent, Cia Siab is calling on communities to report incidents.
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Title: Beth Moore: Pandemic is no time for hate

properties.Description: Isabel Kang Speaks Up About Anti-Blackness Within the Korean Community at a Black Lives Matter Protest
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Theme v2: Our Beloved Community Is Abundant, Caring and Joyful
properties.Title: Korean-American ‘Ajumma’ Talks Korean Solidarity With Black Lives

properties.Description: In the city of Philadelphia, 18 citizens help raise $150,000 for the Brad and Roses Community Fund for the purpose of providing funding towards public areas. The 20 grants will go toward supporting equitable space projects in the city, such as a garden used for Asian-American cultural events, park and library programs for African and Caribbean immigrants, and a neighborhood marketplace in North Philadelphia.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez (double check)
properties.Title: Why 18 strangers spent 6 months raising $150,000 for Philly public spaces

properties.Description: Local activism and a national movement reshaped policy with board members taking a major step toward in removing officers from schools in Madison.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Madison School Board votes unanimously to end police in schools contract

properties.Description: A rally supporting the removal of School Resource Officers (SROs) from the Madison Metropolitan School District (MMSD) turned into a march Thursday evening.
properties.Name: Jared Jimenez
properties.Title: Rally supporting the removal of School Resource Officers turns into a march

properties.Description: Latino and African-American residents of the United States have been three times as likely to become infected as their white neighbors, according to the new data, which provides detailed characteristics of 640,000 infections detected in nearly 1,000 U.S. counties. And Black and Latino people have been nearly twice as likely to die from the virus as white people, the data shows.
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Theme v2: We All Belong, Our Narrative Stories
properties.Title: The Fullest Look Yet at the Racial Inequity of Coronavirus

properties.Description: COVID-19 is killing Asian Americans in the Bay Area. In this six-part series, USA TODAY investigates how systemic racism is driving high death rates.
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Title: Asian Americans in San Francisco are dying at alarming rates from COVID-19: Racism is to blame

properties.Description: The school district will allow the contract with police to expire, meaning school resource officers won't be in the high school buildings next year. The move follows a similar decision by the school board in Minneapolis, which terminated a partnership with Minneapolis police just days after the killing of George Floyd.
properties.Name: Victor Tran
properties.Theme v2: Our Beloved Community Is Abundant, Caring and Joyful
properties.Title: St. Paul schools to end contract with SPPD, vote to remove school resource officers
